description: In 1977, Windsor City Council adopted a resolution prohibiting discrimination against city employees on the basis of sexual orientation.
The solution carried by a narrow margin, four to three, and only after outbursts of homophobic comments from members of council and spectators.
WGU had lobbied for support of the resolution.
Windsor was the third Canadian city (after Toronto and Ottawa) to pass such a resolution.
Ron Weinberg was the swing vote
